titleStmt.title: The humble petition and representation of several churches of God in London, commonly (though falsly) called Anabaptists. Which was presented on Monday the second of April, to the supream authority of the nation, the Commons assembled in Parliament. Together with the answer and approbation of the Parliament thereunto.

The humble petition and representation of several churches of God in London, commonly (though falsly) called Anabaptists. Which was presented on Monday the second of April, to the supream authority of the nation, the Commons assembled in Parliament. Together with the answer and approbation of the Parliament thereunto.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Francis Tyton and John Playford, and are to be sold at their shops in Fleet-street, and in the Inner Temple,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
